meanings.definition: To serve as an official in a ceremony or event.
meanings.sent1: She officiated the wedding with grace and poise.
meanings.sent2: The mayor officiated the opening of the new community center.
meanings.sent3: The cat officiated the meeting of the mice in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The sun officiated the dawn, painting the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The teacher officiated the spelling bee, ensuring fair play among the students.

meanings.definition: To perform a ceremony or function as an official.
meanings.sent1: He officiated the oath-taking ceremony for the new recruits.
meanings.sent2: The priest officiated the baptism of the newborn baby.
meanings.sent3: The clown officiated the pie-eating contest with a silly hat on.
meanings.sent4: The conductor officiated the symphony, guiding the musicians with precise movements.
meanings.sent5: The referee officiated the soccer match, making sure the rules were followed.
